com.threecrickets.prudence.util
Class Fallback

java.lang.Object
  org.restlet.Restlet
      com.threecrickets.prudence.util.Fallback
All Implemented Interfaces:
Uniform
public class Fallback
extends Restlet

A restlet that delegates Restlet.handle(Request, Response) to a series of targets in sequence, stopping at the first target that satisfies the condition of wasHandled(Request, Response). This is very useful for allowing multiple restlets a chance to handle a request, while "falling back" to subsequent restlets when those "fail."

If none of the targets "succeeds" in this respect, the response will be left in the same condition as it was in the last attempt.

Supports a simple timed cache that "remembers" which target handled which reference, in order to avoid unnecessary attempts on targets known to fail. Note that in situations in which targets may sometimes fail and sometimes succeed for the same reference, you would want to disable the cache or keep it low.

By default, wasHandled(Request, Response) checks that the response status is not Status.CLIENT_ERROR_NOT_FOUND or Status.CLIENT_ERROR_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED.

Author:
Tal Liron

wasHandled

protected boolean wasHandled(Request request,
                             Response response)
Checks to see if a request was handled after a call to Restlet.handle(Request, Response).

This default implementation checks that the response status is not Status.CLIENT_ERROR_NOT_FOUND or Status.CLIENT_ERROR_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED.

Parameters:
request - The request
response - The response
Returns:
"True" if the request was handled
